column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Now to talk about the food. The brussel sprouts tempura I ordered were just okay. I personally like my brussel sprouts roasted longer so it's easier to bite and more of the flavor comes out. I ordered the Garlic Tonkotsu Ramen
column2: which was the chef special they were offering at the time. I was blown away by how much flavor the broth had. Granted
column3: you can never go wrong with garlic. It was so savory without being salty. The noodles are slightly tougher than previous ramen I had but you can definitely taste and feel how fresh they are. My dad
column5: has finally found a ramen place that meets his high standards. I cannot wait to come back and try their other flavors.
